timeline.message:
IndexerIntegrationTest: Fix method order

IndexerIntegerationTest is annotated with JUnit 4's
org.junit.FixMethodOrder, and is intended to have its tests executed
in an alphabetical order.

However, the JUnit Jupiter test runner does not honor this annotation,
and the order of execution is not alphabetical. Given that the test
passes regardless of the order and this annotation is not honored
anyway, it can just be removed.

Fix assertions

Some test classes in the project use assertions from JUnit 4's
org.junit.Assert class, or even junit.framework.TestCase class.
This patch cleans up the code and replaces them with the corresponding
methods from the modern org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.

Rewrite KubernetesTest as a JUnit Jupiter exception

By instantiating an
io.fabric8.kubernetes.client.server.mock.KubernetesServer object, the
KubernetesTest implicitly using JUnit 4 classes under the hood.

This patch replaces that class with the modern
@EnableKubernetesMockClient extension, allowing for a fully JUnit
Jupiter runtime. As a side bonus, so of the boilerplate code
associated with a KubernetesServer is removed, and the test is cleaner
and easier to maintain.
